review: I have used zpack 250 mg pack (double the dose - first day 500mg). I always make sure to have some carbs before I take it such as crackers or bread as directions mention. I’ve taken it now 3X in my life and never have had any stomach issues with it. I’m only 90 lbs and terrified of vomiting and have an extreme phobia so I had a lot of anxiety before taking it. The stress and anxiety of my throat condition and along with fears of having to take this pill caused me nausea and soft stool, but NOT the actual zpack itself! I prepared by taking a very small dose of Imodium hours before taking my first dose and I will say this probably helped my nerves and tummy to withstand the zpack with ease. Honestly, your conditions may be so severe that the body just embraces the first dose. Every single time I took it, I felt a boost of energy and relieved! Not gonna lie, I felt like a million bucks, like my army was winning! You’ll feel an immediate difference, I promise. Think good thoughts!

I have a good history of Chronic Tonsillitis since childhood and now I'm 34. My specialist been recommending it since 10 years and have worked like  magic pill for me, along with some other meds for swelling and fever. But just works like a charm for me. I have taken amoxicllin, pencillin etc, but none worked. 5 day course with 500mg doses taken twice a day.

Went to our local urgent care facility with a horrible sore throat and was tested for both Covid and Strep. Negative for both. Suffered for 2 more days before going to my regular doctor who promptly put me on a 5-day Azithromycin regimen. I started feeling better the next day and throat pain was pretty much gone by Day 4. I did have some diarrhea which I addressed with partial success by consuming yogurt/probiotics a few hours after taking my dose. Just glad I don’t have an antibiotic-phobic doctor and was able to get relief.

Feeling awful for the last 7 days. I had went to urgent care who did a throat culture and told me I have strep. They gave me Cedfrin which didn’t do much. I went back and they gave me a z pack. I am only on the first day. How long is this going to take to go away? It’s miserable. I have a penicillin allergy and feel so helpless like nobody can help me
azithromycin did not work at all for my son's strep throat.  It got worse.  Doesn't work against strep throat.

Assumed to have strep throat. Symptoms are strong onset sore throat, with purulent exudate on 1 tonsil accompanied by a 104 fever. No cough, no other respiratory issues. Not able to be swabbed due to Covid 19. Prescribed zpak. 500mg day one 250 mg next 4 days. I have taken first and second dose. 0 relief to date,  fever is hovering between 101 with Advil 103 without for 3 days now. Last time I had strep after the first day of amoxicillin I had recovered 80%. I would never recommend anyone take this drug for strep. Another United Health Scare System failure.

This is my second round of 5  azithromycin tabs, not working for tonsillitis.  I have had the diarrhoea, burning throat and sore stomach.  This all worries me because of the Covid 19.  No major fever yet!  I wouldn't recommend this med, to hit or mis!

After having a bad case of strep, the ARNP at the local walk-in clinic prescribed me Azithromycin Tablets USP 250mg.  I was instructed to take two pills at once, followed by one every day thereafter (six pills over five days).  I didn't notice any improvement until the fifth pill on day four.  While the swelling and burning in my throat eventually subsided, I experienced side effects.  My stool turned yellow, I became drowsy, and suffered from heart palpitations.  Seems like the Z-Pak is mainly hit-or-miss depending on the person.

I’m on day 3 Of the z pack out of the 5 days for strep and I see no improvements. I’m actually kinda feeling worse. I have no appetite to eat and whenever I do eat it comes back up. I can barely swallow and I’m so fragile and shaky I have a hard time walking up the stairs and holding myself up. I have no diarrhea thankfully and no stomach pains but the white spots keep spreading. If this isn’t working by tomorrow I’m heading back to the ER. I had strep In September and had an allergic reaction to amoxicillin but it did work very well for me.
I'm on day 2 azithromycin  (3 pills) and I'm not any better. I have added a headache to my list of symptoms. I'm supposed to be feeling better by now.

Azithromycin really messed up my face. I was prescribed it  by a doctor and I had no qualms about it since I'm also a healthcare professional and I haven't really had any bad encounters with it of my patients complaining about serious side effects of the drug. A day after I had taken it, weird itchy pimple-like rashes started popping out on my T-zone. I stopped the meds when I realized that I was experiencing a delayed hypersensitivity reaction to the drug. I went back to the same doctor who advised me to stop taking the drug and prescribed me an antihistamine. It's been 3 days already and I don't see my skin getting better anytime soon. It's so itchy and scaly. My esteem has dipped since getting this rash on my face because I've always had really clear skin. I would not recommend this drug at all....
This is one of the best drug for strep infection omg!! It is a life saver from pain just, 30 min after I took one I already felt better could swallow easily! and its only 5 day meds!

Azithromycin made me awfully sick, I was constantly shaking and could not keep my food down, was very stomach sick but it did clear my tonsillitis and strep (I had both at the same time) considering it rebounded.

I am usually nervous to take antibiotics. I've had really bad reactions to others so reading these reviews scared  me. I got this for strep throat and had to take 2 a day for 3 days. I've just taken my last dose and have had no reaction other than a tad tired/foggy feeling for a few hours after taking and a bit gassy. Its also cleared my symptoms up a lot so far :)

Woke up with chills and my throat on fire and went to urgent care the next day. I was prescribed a z-pack because I’m allergic to penicillin. The first day I got diarrhea, the second day I got diarrhea, the third day same thing and my symptoms worsened and seemed to spread to my left ear. I can’t sleep a full night and can barely eat. I cringe every time I swallow.  I’m disgusted with the health industry and poor antibiotics.

On the second day of my fever my tonsils were swollen and had white spots. No runny nose, no cough. Dr prescribed the z-pack. Now I'm on 3rd day and feeling much better - the pain and swelling have reduced significantly.For those who are suffering from viral and getting the throat swab negative, I think they cannot expect positive effect of azithromycin or any other antibiotic, as antibiotics are not for viral infection and in such cases antibiotics may only help in preventing secondary bacterial infection. It may also not show significant improvement for those whose bacteria is azithromycin resistant.I had taken levofloxacin and had adverse side effects - Achilles' tendon problem and peripheral neuropathy. Since than azithromycin has been a powerful antibiotic choice for me.

I had what was assumed to be tonsillitis (no actual test was done).  First day I just had a minor sore throat, second day was a little worse, thought I was just getting a cold.  Third day was a little worse still, and I started getting white spots on my tonsils.  Doctor gave me 5 days of azithromycin which I started immediately.The spots on my tonsils got worse even with the meds, however on day 4 of the medication I began to see improvements.  And at that point each day got better.  Because the meds continue working for days 6-10, I was not worried.It works but it might take time - if you don't see progress after the 5 days prescribed, talk to your doctor.

Azithromycin Dose Pack (azithromycin):Woke up with that tingle I get right as Strep starts to set in. 12 hours later I'm in considerable pain. Went to Urgent Care for a strep test. It was positive. I asked the PA for the Z-pak because I needed something I didn't have to take 4 times a day and would work quickly. The Pharmacy filled my prescription around 10:45pm. Took the first dose as soon as I got in my truck. It is only 3.5 hours into the first dose and my throat is almost normal. My stomach feels a little funny but I will take that over strep pain any day.

Zithromax (azithromycin):This is the only antibiotic that ever works for me. Whenever I have a cold and the Dr claims it is viral, it always goes to my tonsils. This time I waited 7 days suffering fever and a throat so sore I could not swallow, and eventually went to the pharmacist and asked for Zithromax z pak. Within 1 day I was 80 percent healed. No side effects. It works for me everyntime. By day 2, all sinus congestion had gone and I got my first real sleep in two weeks.

I was diagnosed with strep in the ER and they sent me home with azithromycin. I took the first dose before bed and was fine until I woke up with extremely itchy feet. Just thought I had walked in something. Took it again the next day and my feet got worse overnight. Couldn't sleep from the itching. Severe swelling and a rash. It moved to my hands too. Went to the Dr immediately and they said to stop taking the meds. Allergic reaction apparently? It seemed to help my strep though!

Hi my name is Annabelle. I went to the ER on October 19th because of my throat been hurting for about two weeks before I went, the doctor said that he thought I had strep throat that test came back negative but there was a few white spots on the back of my tongue so they gave me two shots you know where and said that it will clear it up well I still haven't felt better so a month later I went to Urgent Care and he told me that he didn't think it was strep throat that it's pharyngitis so he put me on a z-pack the 5 days for 500mg and I'm on the 4th day now and my throat feels worse and it has white spots on the back and on my tonsils and I feel worse is this normal?

The first day taking the medication I experienced extreme stomach pain and loose stools. I ate dinner about an hour before and still experienced the side effects. The second day taking the medication I am still experiencing the extreme stomach pain accompanied with loose stools and back pain. I took this pill on a full stomach. On the bright side my tonsils are less inflamed.

I was prescribed a 3 day, 500mg dosage. It got 5x worse within the first two days which had me scared for day 3. My throat was so swollen that I haven't eaten since Friday. Today is Monday. I have made absolutely no progress. I am 20 years old, 6'4, 220lbs and very fit. I usually eat 5,000 calories a day in order to stay full because I am very active. Nothing has been worse than the pain from this strep throat, and this medicine hasn't helped at all.

I'm on my 3rd day of this medication for strep throat and take it on a full stomach every day. I haven't had any stomach pain or diarrhea which I usually get with antibiotics, and no weird metallic taste in my mouth either. Only downside is it takes a bit longer to work than most antibiotics, so my throat was killing me until halfway through the day after taking the third pill. Aside from that, no side effects and I'm feeling much better now! My tonsil is still a little swollen but most of the pus is gone and no more pain.
It's my first day taking the first two pink pills. It took away my ear infection but my throat still hurts when I swallow and about 2 hours after taking the pills I had watery diarrhea

I am very allergic to a multitude of antibiotics....I have suffered with strep/tonsillitis since I was a child...every spring, every fall.  The ONLY thing that works for me is the 5 day Z-pack.  As others have said, please eat something first.  I have been prescribed some meds that I haven't taken b/c of the listed side effects....this however has been the only thing to work for me.  In fact, I am on my way in a bit to see the Dr because without fail, the white spots, fever, chills have come on this spring too!!  Good luck to all.

I was diagnosed with strep throat a few days ago and was prescribed zpak because of a penicillin allergy. I took two pills on the first day, and felt better within 24 hours. The only downside to this medicine is when I took the first dose (2 pills, 500mg total) I had HORRIBLE sharp pains from what was gas followed by diarrhea within 2 hours. The next day I took one pill, and had no side effects. I am on my third day and had pains, similar to harsh period cramps and then diarrhea also within two hours. I find it helpful to eat greek yogurt before taking this medicine! It helps ease the pain and I did not have loose stools on the days I ate the yogurt. Overall this medicine is great because it works extremely fast

The secret of taking any antibiotics is full-stomach.  Meaning, you should eat a full meal even you don't have an appetite.  A bowl of rice, soup, pooridge, noodles, banana, oatmeal, peanut butter sandwich with honey, or anything you can eat. Full stomach before you take the medicine (in fact any kind of medicine even vitamins) is a key to not feel all the side effects.  Also, if you feel too much side effects (nausea, vomiting, dizziness), you may be allergic to one content of the medicine you are taking.  You should check on it!  Like, I usually get Augmentin for my tonsils and ear infection but I constantly getting the same side effects when I take it then I found out I was allergic to pennicilin content.
"I'm on my fourth day of this medicine for strep throat and my throat is in unbearable pain still. It really has not done anything for me. Horrible and would not recommend using."Not good medicine
Used a three day pack .pretty useful.i have my tonsilities treated
Azithromycin Dose Pack (azithromycin):Its not working at all I'm still in pain

I was diagnosed with severe ear infection from tonsilitis. Took two pills and then thought i was gonna die from the side effects plus it didnt seem to be helping me. I went back to the doctor who told me to continue on the 5day pack and ensure i took the pills on a very full stomach. i did just that and now i have completed my 5day pack with no more side effects. Not sure of its effectiveness still have the ear infection that got worse with hearing almost to nil in my left ear.
Horrible!  ! ! The stomach pain is like going into labor.  But it WORKED .

All medications have risk for side effects some people get them and some don't. As well as some medications work for others and some don't. We are given medication that is recommended base in research. If first line therapy does not work then they go to what is recommended next.

I was diagnosed with strep & prescribed Amoxicillin 2x/day for 10 days. I thought it worked at first, then 3 days later it came back with a vengeance. So, I was then prescribed the Z-pack (2/day 1 then 1/day for 4 days) I have 1 more pill to take till I'm finished. But, I'm not sure it is working either. The sore throat is gone but I have a relentless cough & a ton of chest congestion. I have had mild side effects...nausea, tender stomach, not a big appetite.  Still feeling really foggy & weak. I do recommend drinking either Boost or Ensure nutritional drinks while on antibiotics & taking a probiotic.

I was prescribed this medicine after they ran out of options as to what it could be. I only took 2 of the five pills prescribed to me. Yes I know that's bad but my throat and other symptoms cleared up and I couldn't handle the stomach problems this caused me. Terrible diarrhea and cramps, constant nausea.

I just want to say to people out there that are scared to take antibiotics (like myself) do not look up these silly reviews it will only scare you more from taking them. I had to deal with strep for a month before I could actually take my antibiotic because people on here made it seem like it was the worst drug they've ever had. So far I've had no side effects. And it's working great. My suggestion is don't try and research what other people have said about it. Try it for yourself.

I thought I caught it early. So they prescribed a z pack. day 2 the white spots spread to other tonsil. day 3 stiffness in neck and still pain with swallowing. day 4 right side skin swollen in mouth to were I could not see my tonsil. Went to urgent care and they prescribed me a different antibiotic.

Went to the doctor for fever, severe dizziness, and some sinus drainage and sore throat. My flu swab came back negative, so she labeled it as acute pharyngitis, prescribed 5 day Z pak. Less than 2 hours after my first dose, I had horrible, painful diarrhea. I also began to experience severe stomach pain even though I made sure to take it with plenty of food. My symptoms did not improve,  and I began having headaches as well. It is now the day after my final dose, and my sore throat is back, my fever is still high,  head hurts, and I'm dizzy as ever though my stomach is finally feeling better now that I'm out of this useless medicine.

Finished taking meds today.  Its worse my fever spiking to 100.7..white paste is now on both tonsils. 800mg Motrin up  to 4 times a day..neck and shoulder pain..strep and flu swabs were negative.  Seeking more treatment tomorrow.

I have been on this for three days now with the five pack dose. (250mg). The first day I had to take two and I threw it up, because I had nothing in my stomach. If you take this eat something before you take the dose. I'm on day three now, and I feel no pain, but my tonsils still look the same?? Will it eventually die down? I now have a pretty bad cough, along with a lot of sinuses in my head.

I have been taking these for the past three days and it has made my throat worse (I have blisters in the back of my throat) it has made me tired, given me headaches, and my stomach has been killing me

Took 4 days of this medicine to no prevail. I actually got worse and ended up back at the take care clinic to be immediately sent to the emergency room because they thought I had an abscess on my tonsils. I'm happy that got ruled out, but I will never take a Z-pack again. They should have prescribed amoxicillin the Er Doctor said.

Took this 5 day treatment in the past a couple of times and it worked great. This time (2015) urgent care doc recommended amoxicillin, 2x day for ten days. I asked for the Z-pack and they agreed. Now on day 5, still coughing and throat tender. Wife and daughter got the amoxicillin on same day, all better. I guess this strep is resistant? Hopefully knocks it out in the next couple of days. Next time I would go for the amoxicillin for sure :)

Seems to be working very slowly wish urgent care practitioner would have gave me a more aggressive antibiotic. I also got a large thick shot in the upper butt. Don't know what it was but opted for it for a faster reaction so don't really know if the z pack is even working at all. Day 2 of 5

Started feeling bad with strep symptoms on Monday accompanied by fever, chills, body aches and swollen throat. Went to the ER. Culture came back positive. Dr gave me ibuprofen, zithromax and prednisone before leaving. Left with rx for those two and have felt no symptoms since. Other than my stomach being torn up from the meds, i think the prednisone has made all the difference this time. This is the 3rd time this year alone i have had it.
I'm on my fourth day of this medicine for strep throat and my throat is in unbearable pain still. It really has not done anything for me. Horrible and would not recommend using.

I  was prescribed azithromycin for tonsilitis/phyrangitis. On day 4 with the z-pak and still can't eat can't even swallow my own saliva without being afraid it will hurt. This medication is completely useless my swelling hasn't gone down and the pus pockets are now on the right side of my throat.  I am in so much pain haven't eaten for 4 days

Was given the five day pack for strep throat. Day four and finally improving a bit. Probably not the strongest or beat for strep, but slowly does the job and works for five days after completing meds.

After tolerating an increasingly lumpy, sore, raw, dry throat and overall fatigue for about  10 days  I finally went to the doctor. Z-pac and prednisone reduced the symptoms dramatically in 2 days. I didn't realize just how badly I felt.  Taken exactly as prescribed this was certainly the right treatment. It's working.
Very good medication. My Dr told me that it is a very strong antibiotic my throat cleared in 4 days . Thank goodness!

After 2 days of this antibiotic, I felt no difference. I went to another Doctor who game me betadine liquid to gargle. Next day my sore throat improved little. But after 4 days of azithromycin and 2 days of betadine gargle, I feel good but still unable to swallow food/drink except milk. Hope it gets better in another couple of days.

Had Strep Throat, couldn't get to see Dr for 7 days, extreme pain, fever, chills, couldn't eat or swallow.  Dr prescribed Zithromax 500mg (1 tab for 3 days). After 1st day noticed significant difference, 2nd day, almost gone completely!!  I was feeling so hopeless before taking this med, like it would go on forever. Zithromax knocked it out so quickly!! Feeling better and back to work/ normal life.
Took two at 10 pm and by noon the next day my throat was better by half. Could hardly swallow my own spit it was so painful. It was a drastic improvement.
I started feeling better within the hour   but as the night progressed I had a stomach ache and non stop diarrhea. I guess you can't win every time.
I was prescribed this along with a steroid pack. I'm on my fourth day and I will admit I feel a little better. Although it still doesn't look so great, I still have 2 more days.

I've used this medication in the past and now recently for a bad throat infection, I was given the 5 day pack, after the first day (2 tablets) taken it started to feel better... And slowly it's been improving everyday. I did experience bad stomach side effects, diarrhea mainly, but I expected that since I wasn't eating well from the throat infection.  Took my last tablet today and I hope that it's gone but the symptoms have definitely improved. If you do get an upset stomach try to take it with food.  Good medication all in all though.

My young son was presciribed this for severe tonsillitis. His fevers were very high. Paracetamol would bring it down but it would be right back up long before 4 hrs were up. The Azithromycin just made him sicker. He had the worst diarrhea and gas and abdominal pain which was very difficult for an already miserable child. After 3 days he wasn't improving and was changed to a different medication.

This was the wonder pill for me. I was prescribed this alongside a steroid pack and told to take 3-4 regular ibuprofens for the pain in my throat. Let me say, it was VERY severe; I couldn't swallow much, hadn't eaten. I woke up the next day with NO fever and much less swelling and pain. This is my second day on this antibiotic.

I'm taking the Z-pak and it started working after the first day. I already feel much better. I have had stomach cramps but it only lasts like a minute. Overall I'm happy and happy to get back to work.
Zithromax (azithromycin):Worked quickly and efficiently. Throat pain decreased within 2-3 days, nose congestion decreased within one day.
Zithromax (azithromycin):I experience hallucinations (bad dreams) while using this medicine.

Azithromycin Dose Pack (azithromycin):It worked fast and I felt better after four days, but my side effects were diahrrea two hours after each dose and itchy skin with a rash. Now 2 weeks after finishing the prescription I have an infection in my mouth and throat -- oral yeast infection or thrush is listed as a side effect.

Zithromax (azithromycin):I was prescribed a 5 day Z-Pak to treat a Streptococcal pharyngitis infection.  After the second day, the medication reduced the swelling and throat pain, but began to cause stomach cramping and pain.  By the end of the third day the stomach pain was severe and Doctor recommended to discontinue use.  This is the only antibiotic I have used that has caused an allergic reaction.
Azithromycin Dose Pack (azithromycin):I had strep throat and have been taking this medicine for 3 days and I still have a sore throat. I feel like I have a sinus infection now.
Zithromax (azithromycin):It worked fast and I didn't have to take a lot of it. Only once in 3 days.
Zithromax (azithromycin):My ears hurt from the throat infection. This medicine gives relief in a couple of days and finished the infection off.I am well again.
Azithromycin Dose Pack (azithromycin):Amazing results from a Z-Pak!  I had strep throat, and love the convenience of a 5 day run of antibiotics.  I had no apparent side effects from the medication.
